author: RICH SCHAPIRO
title: Trump touts illegal immigration crackdown to manufacturing CEOs
text:
President Trump touts sweeping new guidelines that target undocumented immigrants to manufacturing CEOs Trump touts illegal immigration crackdown to manufacturing CEOs President Donald Trump speaks during a meeting with manufacturing executives in the Roosevelt Room of the White House Thursday in Washington, D.C. (Evan Vucci/AP)  05 PM 
In a rambling opening statement to a roomful of manufacturing CEOs, Donald Trump boasted about his crackdown on illegal immigration. 
“All of a sudden, we’re getting gang members out, we’re getting drug lords out of this country,” Trump said Thursday at the start of the White House “listening session.” 
“We’re getting really bad dudes out of this country at a rate no one has seen before,” he added. 
The President’s comments came two days after the Department of Homeland Security released new guidelines that could lead to the most widespread deportations the country has seen in decades. Several of Trump’s top economic advisers attended the event, including Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross. (SAUL LOEB/AFP/Getty Images) 
Under the new policy, millions of undocumented immigrants could be kicked out of the country, including those whose only crimes were traffic violations. 
Trump, in his address to the two dozen CEOs, once again brought up Hillary Clinton. 
Trump praised Lockheed Martin CEO Marillyn Hewson for agreeing to cut what he said was $700 million from the latest U.S. deal to buy about 90 f-35 Joint Strike Fighters. “We’re getting really bad dudes out of this country at a rate no one has seen before.” — President Trump 
“Do you think Hillary would’ve asked for $700 million?” Trump said to Hewson, who was seated directly across from him. 
“I assume you would have wanted her to win,” Trump added. “But, you know, you’re going to do great.” 
Hewson didn’t respond. Trump, in his address to the two dozen CEOs, once again brought up Hillary Clinton. (KEVIN LAMARQUE/REUTERS) 
The President had earlier cited the savings as $600 million. 
Several of Trump’s top economic advisers attended the event, including Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross. 
Ivanka Trump was also in attendance, even though she doesn’t hold an official position in her father’s administration.
